ags:resource.dc:title: FATTY ACIDS, a-TOCOFEROL AND L-CARNITINE: THEIR RELATIONSHIPS IN TURBOT (Scophthalmus maxímus L. GROWTH: FIRST RESULTS.
ags:resource.dc:subject: Fatty acids
alfa-tocoferol
L-carnitine
Growth
Turbot
Scophthalmus maximus
ags:resource.dc:description:
The effect that the administration of diets rich in essential fattyacids has on growth in weight of turbot (S. maxímus), contrasted with non-enriched diets supplemented with a-tocoferol, and at two different levels of administration of l-carnitine has be en studied.
The weight of individual s corresponding to the different levels of treatment is analysed using MANOVA of repeated measures, resulting in significant differences between the different treatments, with p<O.OOl.
An evaluation is made of the efficiency of each of the different treatments with respect to growth and body content in fat and protein.
